meanings.definition: Used as the reflexive form of 'they'.
meanings.sent1: After the game, the players congratulated themselves for their hard work.
meanings.sent2: The children made the sandwiches themselves for the picnic.
meanings.sent3: The cats thought they could catch the laser pointer dot by chasing themselves.
meanings.sent4: The trees in the forest whispered to themselves in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The students reminded themselves to study for the upcoming test.

meanings.definition: Used to emphasize the identity of the subject or object.
meanings.sent1: The students themselves organized the charity event.
meanings.sent2: The birds built the nest themselves without any help.
meanings.sent3: The puppies were so excited they kept chasing themselves in circles.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky seemed to shine brighter than themselves.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden bloomed by themselves in the warm sunlight.
